author: customer
text: I purchased a bag that was not authentic. Once I received my order, it didn’t take long for me to realize it was not a real Gucci bag. I paid over $50 in customs in addition to the price paid for the bag as well as shipping. I won’t receive compensation for the money I wasted on customs which sucks because I wanted to love the product and keep it. Returning it was not a choice but a must. I will not be purchasing anything from this site again and have advised friends against it as well that were considering making a purchase.
title: they sold me a fake Gucci bag

author: customer
text:
I am sorry to be writing this review, but the customer service is seemingly non-existent. I sent a text to the number posted on the site, for "immediate assistance" with my account. The assistance requested was for a follow up on a large consignment sent on January 19th -- none of the items have posted to my account, and I received no response to the text I sent, nor to the email I sent regarding the same issue. Despite the note packing slip that says “you can track the status 24/7 on your My Sales page”…..there is no way to do this. The person who handled the consignment, Kennedy, my account rep has seemingly vaporized. We have had no response on any of this. This also is not the first time I have had an issue with consignments-- just prior to this consignment, there were several pieces that were posted mistakenly, to the account of the person who took the consignments in for me. That took weeks to resolve. Doesn't really want to make one send in expensive designer goods that seem to go into the ether.

Some help would be appreciated.
title: Consignor Relations? Really?
